p: Bst 2.0 DNA polymerase is an in silico designed enzyme homologue of Bacillus stearothermophilus DNA polymerase I. The enzyme contains 5′-3′ DNA polymerase activity and strong strand displacement activity, but lacks 5′-3′ exonuclease activity. Compared to its wild-type homologue, Bst 2.0 DNA polymerase has improved thermostability, salt tolerance, yield, and provides faster amplification [ 66, 67]. Although Bst 2.0 exhibits RT activity [ 41], it is recommended to also add a dedicated reverse transcriptase to LAMP reactions for more consistent and robust amplification of RNA targets [ 27, 39].
